author: Special Correspondent
text:
A court here has sentenced four persons, who stole gold ornaments and cash from the house of a doctor, to seven years imprisonment.

According to prosecution, Saravanakumar (40) of Thiruvadanai in Ramanathapuram district, who was working as a cook in the house of Dr. Jayapriya in Maharaja Nagar in Palayamkottai, stole 15 sovereigns of gold and Rs. 1.35 lakh in cash with the help of his friends Venkatesh (30) of Tirupur, Sundaralingam (32), Periyapandi (31) and Chinnapandi, all from Devakottai.

Following a complaint from Dr. Jayapriya, the culprits were arrested. When they were enlarged on bail, Chinnapandi went underground.

After the case against the remaining four accused was heard, Additional Assistant Sessions Judge A.K.K. Rajini sentenced them to seven years imprisonment and slapped a fine of Rs. 2,000 each on Friday. The case against Chinnapandi is pending.
title: Seven-year jail for four
